content:
Storing Custom Information

Also, by using the functions ~.NodePath.set_tag() and ~.NodePath.get_tag() you can store your own information in key-value pairs. For example:

python

myNodePath.setTag("Key", "value")

cpp

myNodePath.set_tag("Key", "value");

python

You can also store Python objects as tags by using the ~.NodePath.set_python_tag() function with the same arguments.

Removing Nodes

To completely remove a node from the scene graph you can call the following, which has the effect of emptying the node and releasing the memory taken up by the node. Use it only when you have no further use for the node:

python

myModel.removeNode()

cpp

myModel.remove_node();
